data.text: The letter Z, also called <internalXref urlencoded="zee">zee</internalXref> and sometimes <internalXref urlencoded="izzard">izzard</internalXref>.
A metal bar rolled so as to have a cross-section resembling the letter Z.
The letter <xref urlencoded="z">z</xref>; -- called also <altname>zee</altname>, and formerly <altname>izzard</altname>.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: The name of the <xref>Latin script</xref> letter <xref>Z</xref>/<xref>z</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: Something Z-shaped. Found in compounds such as zed-bar.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: To <xref>zigzag</xref>; to move with sharp alternating turns.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: the 26th letter of the Roman alphabet
